template.name: New empty project
template.description: Create a new empty project with default settings.

template.name: New retro style project
template.description: Create a platform-neutral project with settings and objects suited to retro style games (such as pixellated rather than smooth scaling).

template.name: New empty SD landscape 4:3 project
template.description: Create a new empty project with a standard definition 4:3 landscape screen.

template.name: New empty SD portrait 4:3 project
template.description: Create a new empty project with a standard definition 4:3 portrait screen.

template.name: New empty SD landscape 16:9 project
template.description: Create a new empty project with a standard definition 16:9 landscape screen.

template.name: New empty SD portrait 16:9 project
template.description: Create a new empty project with a standard definition 16:9 portrait screen.

template.name: New empty HD landscape 720p project
template.description: Create a new empty project with a high definition 720p (16:9) landscape screen.

template.name: New empty HD portrait 720p project
template.description: Create a new empty project with a high definition 720p (16:9) portrait screen.

template.name: New empty HD landscape 1080p project
template.description: Create a new empty project with a high definition 1080p (16:9) landscape screen.

template.name: New empty HD portrait 1080p project
template.description: Create a new empty project with a high definition 1080p (16:9) portrait screen.

template.name: Template: Platformer
template.description: A project with a basic platform game setup prepared.

template.name: Template: Top-down shooter
template.description: A project with a basic top-down shooter game setup prepared.

template.name: Template: Vertical space shooter
template.description: A project with a basic vertical space shooter game setup prepared.

template.name: Template: Driving game
template.description: A project with a basic driving game setup prepared.

template.name: Template: Turret Defense
template.description: A project with a basic turret defense game setup prepared.

template.name: Template: Infinite jumping
template.description: A project with a basic infinite jumping platformer setup prepared, with mobile control support.

template.name: Template: Auto-runner
template.description: A project with a basic sideways always-moving platformer setup prepared, with mobile control support.

template.name: Template: Flapping bird
template.description: A variation on the flying template where you control a bird that has to fly through gaps.

template.name: Template: Flying along
template.description: A classic helicopter/dodge the obstacles flying game template, with mobile control support.

template.name: Template: Physics Puzzle
template.description: A project with a basic physics-based puzzle game prepared, with touch support.

template.name: Template: Physics Catapult
template.description: A project with a basic physics-based catapult game prepared, with touch support.

template.name: Template: Real Time Strategy (RTS)
template.description: An advanced template showing how to set up an RTS style game with user-commanded units which aim and fire at enemies.

demo.name: Ghost Shooter (tutorial version)
demo.description: The completed Beginner's Guide tutorial, with a few extras added.

demo.name: Ghost Shooter ('Rain demo' version)
demo.description: A reworked version of the Ghost Shooter tutorial, making heavy use of visual effects.

demo.name: Space Blaster
demo.description: An example space shoot-em-up game which also uses touch controls to work on mobile.

example.name: 8 direction behavior (part 1)
example.description: A trivial example of the 8 direction movement.

example.name: 8 direction behavior (part 2)
example.description: Stop the player rotating by changing a behavior setting.

example.name: 8 direction behavior (part 3)
example.description: Adds an event to make the player look at the mouse.

example.name: 8 direction behavior (part 4)
example.description: Adds another behavior to prevent the player leaving the layout.

example.name: 8 direction behavior (part 5)
example.description: The player now shoots a bullet when the player clicks the mouse.

example.name: 8 direction behavior (part 6)
example.description: Using an image point to change the bullet spawn location.

example.name: 9-patch object
example.description: Shows how to use the 9-patch object to draw images that only stretch their middle part.

example.name: Ambient Light
example.description: Shows how to use the User Media object to get an ambient light reading in lux, if supported.

example.name: Audio analyser
example.description: Shows how to display a live graph of frequency information from the playback if advanced audio is supported.

example.name: Audio effects
example.description: An sound effect pad showing various effects that can be added if advanced audio is supported.

example.name: Audio scheduling
example.description: Schedule sound playback at a sample-accurate time using the 'Schedule next play' action.

example.name: Blend modes
example.description: Shows what each blend mode setting in the Sprite object does.

example.name: Bouncing balls
example.description: Use the Bullet behavior to create a bouncing ball movement.

example.name: Bouncing bullets
example.description: Shows how bullets can bounce off solids.

example.name: Canvas recording
example.description: Demonstrates how to use the User Media object to record a video of the canvas (where supported).

example.name: Car behavior
example.description: A simple demo of the Car movement.

example.name: Custom movement (asteroids)
example.description: An Asteroids type movement using the Custom Movement behavior.

example.name: Detecting the input method
example.description: How to create a title screen that automatically detects whether keyboard/mouse or touch controls are available, and switches controls accordingly.

example.name: Falling blocks
example.description: An advanced example using recursive functions to determine which blocks are connected to the ground, and allowing those which are not to fall down.

example.name: Families
example.description: A simple example of how Families can be used to avoid repeating events.

example.name: Fullscreen scaling
example.description: Demonstrates how to use a fullscreen mode to fill the browser window.

example.name: Gamepad control
example.description: A simple demo of how to use the Gamepad plugin as an alternative input to control a game.

example.name: Geolocation
example.description: A simple example of how to use the Geolocation plugin and show the resulting position on Google Maps.

example.name: Instance Variables
example.description: Shows how each instance of an object can store its own values, such as for health.

example.name: Lighting
example.description: Use layers and blend modes to create a lighting effect.

example.name: Line-of-sight
example.description: Using the Line-of-sight (LOS) behavior to determine if objects can "see" each other.

example.name: Microphone input
example.description: An example of using the User Media object to get live audio input to the Audio object through a microphone.

example.name: Move to mouse
example.description: Click to move an object to a position.

example.name: Multiplayer - chat room
example.description: An example of a chat room using the Multiplayer plugin. This is the simplest demonstration of how to use the Multiplayer object features.

example.name: Multiplayer - real-time game
example.description: The ghost shooter game adapted to a real-time multiplayer shoot-em-up. See the accompanying tutorial for more information.

example.name: Multiplayer - pong
example.description: A very simple multiplayer game, with two players controlling a paddle each.

example.name: Multiple colored shadow-casting lights
example.description: Demonstrates an advanced lighting effect with three moving colored shadow-casting lights that blend with each other.

example.name: Particle effect
example.description: An example of a full-screen particle effect.

example.name: Particle single fountain
example.description: A fountain effect created with the Particles object.

example.name: Particle double fountain
example.description: Two fountains created with the Particles object.

example.name: Particle explosions
example.description: Use one-shot particle objects to create an explosion effect.

example.name: Particle fire
example.description: Using the Particles object to create a fire effect.

example.name: Particle thruster
example.description: Using the Particles object to create a controlled space ship thruster effect.

example.name: Pathfinding demo
example.description: An example of how the Pathfinding behavior can return a path around obstacles and move an object along it.

example.name: Pathfinding path cost
example.description: Shows how using objects to increase path cost can make the behavior take detours. Useful for simulating different terrain types.

example.name: Persistent layouts
example.description: Shows how to use the Persist behavior to make layouts which remember their state when you come back to them later.

example.name: Physics basics
example.description: A simple demo of how the Physics behavior works.

example.name: Physics force point
example.description: Shows how movement is affected by changing the point a force is applied from.

example.name: Physics distance joint
example.description: Connect two Physics objects with a distance joint.

example.name: Physics revolute joint
example.description: Hinge together two Physics objects with a revolute joint.

example.name: Physics vehicle
example.description: Shows how to make contraptions like this vehicle by using multiple Physics joints.

example.name: Physics ragdoll
example.description: Create a ragdoll effect using a series of Physics joints.

example.name: Physics rolling platformer
example.description: Re-creating a platform style movement using a rolling object and the Physics behavior.

example.name: Pick Nearest
example.description: Shows how to highlight the object nearest the mouse using the 'Pick nearest' condition.

example.name: Pin behavior
example.description: Demonstrates how the Pin behavior can be used to connect objects.

example.name: Pin chain style
example.description: Create a rigid chain of objects by pinning together a line of sprites.

example.name: Pin rope style
example.description: Create a loose "rope" of objects by pinning together a line of sprites.

example.name: Platform behavior (part 1)
example.description: A simple demo of the Platform movement behavior.

example.name: Platform behavior (part 2)
example.description: Adds scrolling to the previous example.

example.name: Platform behavior (part 3)
example.description: Use zero-parallax layers to display objects on a fixed place on the screen.

example.name: Platform behavior (part 4)
example.description: How to change which keys are used to control a behavior.

example.name: Platform behavior (part 5)
example.description: The previous example but now showing in the full browser window.

example.name: Platform behavior (part 6)
example.description: Demonstrates how the Platform behavior can handle slopes and moving platforms.

example.name: Platform behavior (part 7)
example.description: How to use layers to create a parallax scrolling effect.

example.name: Platform behavior (part 8)
example.description: How to shake the screen with the Scroll To behavior.

example.name: Platform behavior (part 9)
example.description: Demonstrates how the player can jump on to objects from underneath with the 'Jump-thru' behavior.

example.name: Positioned audio
example.description: An example of a layout with several positioned sound sources in it, where the audio pan and volume adjusts depending on the location.

example.name: Rotating platformer
example.description: Use rotating layers and changing gravity angle to make a platform game that spirals in a circle.

example.name: Savegames
example.description: The Ghost Shooter tutorial modified to support full-state savegames using the System object 'Save' and 'Load' actions.

example.name: Sine behavior types
example.description: Demonstrates each type of Sine movement the behavior provides.

example.name: Shadows - colors
example.description: Using three lights with opacity and different shadow colors to create a colorful multiple light effect.

example.name: Shadows - light height
example.description: An example of a real-time shadow effect using the Shadow Light object and Shadow Caster behavior.

example.name: Shadows - soft penumbras
example.description: Another shadow example that uses a light radius to cast soft-edged shadows penumbras in WebGL mode.

example.name: Sine behavior grass effect
example.description: A simple use of the Sine behavior for a waving grass effect.

example.name: Speech recognition
example.description: How to use the User Media object to recognise words spoken by the user in to a microphone.

example.name: Speech synthesis
example.description: How to use the User Media object to read out some text (also known as text-to-speech or TTS).

example.name: Taking screenshots
example.description: How to use canvas snapshots and the Browser object to take screenshots and download them as image files.

example.name: The 'Wait' action
example.description: A simple example of how to use the system 'Wait' action to schedule actions.

example.name: Tilemaps
example.description: A simple example of how tile-based games can be more easily designed using the Tilemap object.

example.name: Touch - panning
example.description: How to scroll around a layout using touch input to pan the view.

example.name: Touch - zooming
example.description: How to both scroll and scale a layout based on single and double touches.

example.name: Touch - rotating
example.description: How to both scroll and rotate a layout based on single and double touches.

example.name: Turret behavior
example.description: A simple example of using the Turret behavior to aim and fire at objects in range.

example.name: Turret predictive aim
example.description: Using the Turret behavior's predictive aim feature to aim more accurately at moving targets.

example.name: Unique IDs (UIDs)
example.description: An introduction to UIDs, which can be used to store a reference individual instances.

example.name: Vibrate
example.description: An example of the Browser object's 'Vibrate' action to vibrate a mobile device.

example.name: Webcam
example.description: Get a webcam feed from the user's camera using the User Media object.

example.name: Webcam effects
example.description: A demo of applying effects to the User Media object.

example.name: Webcam face shape
example.description: Cut out a shape from a webcam feed using layer masks with the User Media object.

example.name: WebGL shader effect
example.description: A simple example of advanced visual effects using WebGL shaders.

example.name: WebGL old TV effect
example.description: Using multiple WebGL shaders to create an old TV appearance.

example.name: WebGL haze effect
example.description: A subtle heat haze effect using WebGL shaders.

example.name: WebGL screen blend & fallback
example.description: Use WebGL effects for advanced blending with a fallback for systems that do not support it.

example.name: WebGL luminance transition
example.description: An advanced luminance based transition based on WebGL effects.

example.name: WebGL pixellate transition
example.description: An advanced pixellation transition based on WebGL effects.

example.name: WebGL ripple transition
example.description: An advanced ripple transition based on WebGL effects.

example.name: WebGL swirl transition
example.description: An advanced swirl transition based on WebGL effects.

example.name: WebGL water transition
example.description: An advanced water transition based on WebGL effects.

example.name: XML
example.description: Use XPath to get data from XML documents.
